text: Terphenylquinones are fungal dyes from the group of phenyl-substituted p-benzoquinones having the following general structure. > Allgemeine chemische Struktur von Terphenylchinonen > General chemical structure of terphenylquinones Also derivatives with a central o-benzoquinone structure are known. == Biosynthesis == The biosynthesis of terphenylquinones is carried out by dimerization of substituted oxophenylpropanoic acids (phenylpyruvic acids). == Occurrence == Terphenylquinones are typical constituents of the boletales. == Examples == :{|class="wikitable sortable" ! Bezeichnung || Struktur|| CAS-Nr. ||Vorkommen |- |Polyporic acid||Polyporsäure||548-59-4||Polypore of the order Aphyllophorales, Lichen Sticta coronata |- |Atromentin||Atromentin||519-67-5||Paxillus atrotomentosus (Basidiomycetes) |- |Aurantiacin||Aurantiacin||548-32-3||Hydnellum aurantiacum (Basidiomycetes) |- |Phlebiarubron||Phlebiarubron||7204-23-1|| Cultures of Phlebia strigoso-zonata and Punctularia atropurpurascens (Basidiomycetes) |- |Spiromentin B||Spiromentin B||121254-56-6||Paxillus atrotomentosus (Basidiomycetes) and cultures of Paxillus panuoides |} == See also == * Thelephoric acid == References == Category:Quinones Category:Aromatic compounds
title: Terphenylquinones
